results.title: How to give exceptional customer service. Vol.4
results.brief_description: This seminar presentation with Lisa Ford looks at becoming a service star: team building, upselling and exceeding expectations. Some of the things you’ll learn include; the five key characteristics of a customer service star and how to develop them, guidelines for successful cross-selling and upselling, and how to make sure you are always increasing your level of customer service. This is perfect for top performers, veterans and high-potential newcomers. It offers dozens of exciting new ideas for doing “the same old job” better than ever. It’s a motivating “how-to” for even the most talented customer service professional.

results.title: How to give exceptional customer service. Vol.3
results.brief_description: This seminar presentation with Lisa Ford looks at pleasing the challenging customer; defusing anger, solving problems and recovery skills. Some of the things you’ll learn include; why customers complain, the most common reason, how to empathise with customers and keys to fast, effective problem solving. This is the antidote to high-stress situations, times when customers seem especially difficult.

results.title: How to give exceptional customer service. Vol. 2
results.brief_description: This customer service training seminar focuses on the service representative- you! It looks at how your skills, attitudes and your follow through influence the transaction. Learn how to get into the exceptional customer service mindset, start building core communication skills such as building rapport and establishing trust, controlling the tone of your voice, using proper body language, listening carefully and also discover high-impact techniques for serving customers over the telephone. Using lively demonstrations of how and how not to serve a customer you’ll remember more because you’ll see exceptional customer service in action!

results.title: How to give exceptional customer service. Vol. 1
results.brief_description: This seminar presentation with Lisa Ford looks at valuing customers, handling complaints and creating “partnership”. Some of what you’ll learn includes the crucial differences between service and exceptional service, the real price of losing a customer, and how to see your service through the customer’s eyes.This is a good overview of today’s customer service function. It show the rising importance of organisational strategy and the crucial role of the front-line customer service professional.

results.title: How to exercise
results.brief_description: Knight Light sets out to fight the dragon but neither is fit for battle. The sorceress of Physical Fitness appears with a shapeup plan for the two weaklings including lessons in the proper way to exercise. Demostrates warm up activities, planning specific exercises, developing routines and setting goals of progression.

results.title: How to drown
results.brief_description: A short treatise on how to drown. A facetious film, the purpose of which is to prevent people from acting thoughtlessly when swimming.

results.title: How to cure inflation
results.creator_credit: Video Arts, Michael Latham and Graham Massey
results.brief_description: Milton Friedman argues that inflation results when the rate of growth of money supply exceeds that of the production of goods and services. The cure is to slow the printing of money, causing short-term increases in unemployment and reductions in growth, but leading to long-term real growth. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.
